revised_title: Experiments on the Velocity of Sound and the Impact of Environmental Factors
tldr: The author describes experiments conducted to measure the velocity of sound and the impact of environmental factors, such as wind and atmospheric conditions, on the accuracy of these measurements. They used advanced techniques, including conical pendulum clocks and improved experimental methods, to obtain more accurate results than previous studies. The findings highlight the importance of accounting for environmental factors when measuring the velocity of sound.
